overlap.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if two or more things overlap, part of one thing covers part of another thing
overlap.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: One of Jilly’s front teeth overlaps the other.
The tiles on the roof overlap.
overlap.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if two subjects, ideas etc overlap, they include some but not all of the same things
overlap.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Maxwell’s responsibilities overlap yours, so you will be sharing some of the work.
two great men with overlapping interests
The study of sociology overlaps with the study of economics.
overlap.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if two activities or periods of time overlap, the second one starts before the first one has finished
overlap.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The second phase of development overlaps the first.
overlap.translation[1].definitions[0].de: the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap
overlap.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: There is considerable overlap between the girls’ and boys’ test results.
an overlap of about two centimetres
